BLIST.ITEM: MeasurementUnit is a physical unit of measure for a data item or value.

BLIST.TITLE: MetaDataVersion defines the types of study events, forms, item groups, and items that form the study data
Protocol lists the kinds of study events that can occur within a specific version of a Study
BLIST.ITEM: StudyEventRef references a StudyEventDef as it occurs within a specific version of a Study

BLIST.TITLE: StudyEventDef describes a type of study event that takes place during a study. A scheduled event is one that is expected to occur for each subject as part of the ordinary progress of the study. An unscheduled event is not expected to occur, but may occur as circumstance dictates. Scheduled and unscheduled events typically occur at some particular time. A common event collects data forms, but is not expected to be associated with a particular time. The Repeating flag indicates that this type of study event can occur repeatedly within the containing study.
BLIST.ITEM: FormRef references a FormDef as it occurs within a specific StudyEventDef

BLIST.TITLE: FormDef describes a type of form that can occur in a study
BLIST.ITEM: ItemGroupRef references an ItemGroupDef as it occurs within a specific FormDef

BLIST.TITLE: ItemGroupDef describes a type of item group that can occur within a study
BLIST.ITEM: ItemRef references an ItemDef as it occurs within a specific ItemGroupDef.

BLIST.TITLE: ItemDef describes a type of item that can occur within a study. Item properties include name, datatype, data size, measurement units, range or codelist restrictions, and several other properties.
BLIST.ITEM: Question is a human-readable label used to name an item on paper or on a screen.
ExternalQuestion is a reference to an externally defined question.

BLIST.TITLE: RangeCheck is a one-sided constraint on an item value (a full range check will require two RangeCheck elements, one for the lower bound and one for the upper bound).
BLIST.ITEM: CheckValue is a comparison value used in a range check.

BLIST.TITLE: ErrorMessage is an error message to be used when a range check is violated.
CodeList defines a discrete set of permitted values for an item. The definition can be an explicit list of values (CodeListItem*) or a reference to an externally defined codelist (ExternalCodeList).
CodeListItem defines an individual member value of a codelist. The actual value is given, along with a set of print-forms.
Decode is the set of print-forms for a codelist value.

BLIST.ITEM: ExternalCodeList is a reference to an externally defined codelist.

BLIST.TITLE: ClinicalData contains the clinical data for multiple subjects.
SubjectData contains the clinical data for a single subject.
StudyEventData contains the clinical data for a study event (visit).
FormData contains the clinical data for a form (page).
ItemGroupData contains the clinical data for an item group (record).
ItemData contains the clinical data for an item.
